page.title: 04Buxhall - Farm Enterprises
page.content: {Cereals}are the predominant crop.{Oil {seed rape, sugarbeet, dried peas}or {field beans}are fairly widely grown as break crops on most farms to avoid continuous cereal production. Livestock is generally unimportant in this area. A{dairy herd}of 75 Jersey cows produces milk which is collected by tanker from a dairy at Sible Hedingham. Milk and cream are also sold at the door.There is a herd of 70 {beef cattle}bought as stores locally or from S.Wales, fattened over winter, and sold at Bury St Edmunds auction market. Whilst{pigs}are important in Suffolk this area has only 2 fattening units run to supplement income on small farms. These are both under contract to an animal feed company. A single{apple orchard}of 10ha. is the only horticultural enterprise.
